page.title: 02INDUSTRY:BOATS AND FISHING
page.content: When we visited the quays at Looe,We discovered that the main fishing method is trawling.There are two middle-water trawlers and twenty-seven near-water trawlers.Some trawlers fish in pairs towing a net between them. They fly a red white and blue flag when they are doing this.The boats are mostly modern stern-trawlers which cost a lot to buy.We were told that even a second-hand boat can cost Â£50,000.Some boats were built at Morval,near Looe.Others were built at Penryn and at other places in Great Britain,such as Scotland.Nets are expensive and are sometimes lost.They cost Â£800-Â£1000.The trawlers have a crew of two or three men.They stay out for a day to two days before landing their catch.There is a fish-packing station with six packers.Most of the fish goes to Plymouth market.(see P.3)
